event.title: now the city of Birmingham was part of land ceded

data.event: The area comprising what is now the city of Birmingham was part of land ceded by Native American tribes to the United States government by the 1807 Treaty of Detroit.

event.title: was delayed first by the War of 1812

data.event: However, settlement was delayed first by the War of 1812 and subsequently by an unfavorable report by the Surveyor-General of the United States, Edward Tiffin, regarding the placement of Military Bounty Lands for veterans of the War of 1812.
In 1818, Territorial Governor Lewis Cass led a group of men along the Indian Trail.
